event.descr:
A overheat trap indicates that the on board tempature sensor has reported a overheat condition. System will shutdown until unit has suficiently cooled such that operation may begin again. A cold start trap will be issued when the unit has come back on line.

sysUpTime %parm[#1]%;

sysDescr %parm[#2]%;

A fan failed trap indicates one or more of the cooling fans inside the device has failed. A fanOK trap will be sent once the fan has attained normal operation.

sysUpTime %parm[#1]%;

sysDescr %parm[#2]%;

A fan has tansitioned out of a failure state and is now operating correctly.

sysUpTime %parm[#1]%;

sysDescr %parm[#2]%;

A user attempted to login to console or by telnet but was refused access due to incorrect username or password

sysUpTime %parm[#1]%;

sysDescr %parm[#2]%;

Indicates the status of Diagnostics for a port. The status indicates whether Diagnostics for a particular port failed

extremeDiagPortCfgPortIfIndex %parm[#1]%;

extremeDiagPortCfgMode %parm[#2]%;

auto(1) manual(2)

extremeDiagPortCfgStatus %parm[#3]%;

enable(1) disable(2) run(3) diagfail(4)
event.logmsg: extremeTrapDiagPortDiagnostics trap received extremeDiagPortCfgPortIfIndex=%parm[#1]% extremeDiagPortCfgMode=%parm[#2]% extremeDiagPortCfgStatus=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The extremeDosThresholdCleared notification is generated when the DOS threshold is cleared .

extremeDosAlertLevel %parm[#1]%;

The extremeDosThresholdReached notification is generated when the DOS threshold is crossed for any of the ports.

extremeDosAlertLevel %parm[#1]%;

The extremeDosThresholdReached notification is generated when the DOS threshold is crossed for any of the ports.

extremeEnhDosPortIfIndex %parm[#1]%;

extremeEnhDosPortRateLimitThreshold %parm[#2]%;

The extremeEnhDosThresholdCleared notification is generated when the DOS threshold is cleared for any of the ports.

extremeEnhDosPortIfIndex %parm[#1]%;

extremeEnhDosPortRateLimitThreshold %parm[#2]%;

Signifies Esrp state change

extremeEsrpDmnName %parm[#1]%;

extremeEsrpDmnGroup %parm[#2]%;

extremeEsrpDmnState %parm[#3]%;

neutral(0) master(1) slave(2) premaster(3) aware(4)

extremeEsrpDmnNetAddress %parm[#4]%;

extremeEsrpDmnMasterMacAddress %parm[#5]%;

extremeEsrpDmnActivePorts %parm[#6]%;

event.descr:
For vlans/ports on which one or more of the IP Security features have been enabled, this trap will be generated when a packet received on that vlan/port is in violation of the configured IP Security protections

extremeIpSecurityVlanIfIndex %parm[#1]%;

extremeIpSecurityVlanDescr %parm[#2]%;

extremeIpSecurityPortIfIndex %parm[#3]%;

extremeIpSecurityIpAddr %parm[#4]%;

extremeIpSecurityMacAddress %parm[#5]%;

extremeIpSecurityViolationType %parm[#6]%;

rogueDhcpServerPacket(1) badIpMacBindingInArpPacket(2) badIpInArpPacket(3) badMacInArpPacket(4)
event.logmsg: extremeIpSecurityViolation trap received extremeIpSecurityVlanIfIndex=%parm[#1]% extremeIpSecurityVlanDescr=%parm[#2]% extremeIpSecurityPortIfIndex=%parm[#3]% extremeIpSecurityIpAddr=%parm[#4]% extremeIpSecurityMacAddress=%parm[#5]% extremeIpSecurityViolationType=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
For ports on which the protocol anomaly protection IP features has been enabled, this trap will be generated when a packet received on that port if the packet's source IP == destination IP

esAnomalyPortIfIndex %parm[#1]%;

esAnomalyVlanIfIndex %parm[#2]%;

esAnomalyVlanDescr %parm[#3]%;

esAnomalySrcMacAddress %parm[#4]%;

esAnomalyDestMacAddress %parm[#5]%;

esAnomalyVlanTag %parm[#6]%;

esAnomalySrcIpAddrType %parm[#7]%;

unknown(0) ipv4(1) ipv6(2) ipv4z(3) ipv6z(4) dns(16)

esAnomalySrcIpAddr %parm[#8]%;

esAnomalyDestIpAddrType %parm[#9]%;

unknown(0) ipv4(1) ipv6(2) ipv4z(3) ipv6z(4) dns(16)

esAnomalyDestIpAddr %parm[#10]%;

esAnomalyIpProto %parm[#11]%;

unknown(0) icmp(1) tcp(6) udp(17)
event.logmsg: extremeIpSecurityAnomalyIpViolation trap received esAnomalyPortIfIndex=%parm[#1]% esAnomalyVlanIfIndex=%parm[#2]% esAnomalyVlanDescr=%parm[#3]% esAnomalySrcMacAddress=%parm[#4]% esAnomalyDestMacAddress=%parm[#5]% esAnomalyVlanTag=%parm[#6]% esAnomalySrcIpAddrType=%parm[#7]% esAnomalySrcIpAddr=%parm[#8]% esAnomalyDestIpAddrType=%parm[#9]% esAnomalyDestIpAddr=%parm[#10]% esAnomalyIpProto=%parm[#11]%

event.descr:
For ports on which the protocol anomaly protection L4port features has been enabled, this trap will be generated when a packet received on that port if 1) the packet is a TCP or UDP packetr. AND 2) its source L4 port == destination port

esAnomalyPortIfIndex %parm[#1]%;

esAnomalyVlanIfIndex %parm[#2]%;

esAnomalyVlanDescr %parm[#3]%;

esAnomalySrcMacAddress %parm[#4]%;

esAnomalyDestMacAddress %parm[#5]%;

esAnomalyVlanTag %parm[#6]%;

esAnomalySrcIpAddrType %parm[#7]%;

unknown(0) ipv4(1) ipv6(2) ipv4z(3) ipv6z(4) dns(16)

esAnomalySrcIpAddr %parm[#8]%;

esAnomalyDestIpAddrType %parm[#9]%;

unknown(0) ipv4(1) ipv6(2) ipv4z(3) ipv6z(4) dns(16)

esAnomalyDestIpAddr %parm[#10]%;

esAnomalyIpProto %parm[#11]%;

unknown(0) icmp(1) tcp(6) udp(17)

esAnomalySrcL4Port %parm[#12]%;

esAnomalyDestL4Port %parm[#13]%;
event.logmsg: extremeIpSecurityAnomalyL4PortViolation trap received esAnomalyPortIfIndex=%parm[#1]% esAnomalyVlanIfIndex=%parm[#2]% esAnomalyVlanDescr=%parm[#3]% esAnomalySrcMacAddress=%parm[#4]% esAnomalyDestMacAddress=%parm[#5]% esAnomalyVlanTag=%parm[#6]% esAnomalySrcIpAddrType=%parm[#7]% esAnomalySrcIpAddr=%parm[#8]% esAnomalyDestIpAddrType=%parm[#9]% esAnomalyDestIpAddr=%parm[#10]% esAnomalyIpProto=%parm[#11]% esAnomalySrcL4Port=%parm[#12]% esAnomalyDestL4Port=%parm[#13]%

event.descr:
For ports on which the protocol anomaly protection TCP flags features has been enabled, this trap will be generated when a TCP packet received on that port if 1) (TCP flag SYN is set) and (its TCP source port < 1024). OR 2) (TCP flag == 0) and (TCP seq # == 0). OR 3) (TCP flag FIN/URG/PSH bits sre set) and (TCP seq # == 0). OR 4) Both TCP iflag SYN and FIN are set

esAnomalyPortIfIndex %parm[#1]%;

esAnomalyVlanIfIndex %parm[#2]%;

esAnomalyVlanDescr %parm[#3]%;

esAnomalySrcMacAddress %parm[#4]%;

esAnomalyDestMacAddress %parm[#5]%;

esAnomalyVlanTag %parm[#6]%;

esAnomalySrcIpAddrType %parm[#7]%;

unknown(0) ipv4(1) ipv6(2) ipv4z(3) ipv6z(4) dns(16)

esAnomalySrcIpAddr %parm[#8]%;

esAnomalyDestIpAddrType %parm[#9]%;

unknown(0) ipv4(1) ipv6(2) ipv4z(3) ipv6z(4) dns(16)

esAnomalyDestIpAddr %parm[#10]%;

esAnomalySrcL4Port %parm[#11]%;

esAnomalyDestL4Port %parm[#12]%;

esAnomalyTcpFlagReason %parm[#13]%;

unknown(0) flagSynAndSrcPort(1) flagAndSeq(2) flagFinAndUrgAandPshandSeq(3) flagSynAndFin(4)

esAnomalyTcpFlag %parm[#14]%;

esAnomalyTcpSeq %parm[#15]%;
event.logmsg: extremeIpSecurityAnomalyTcpFlagViolation trap received esAnomalyPortIfIndex=%parm[#1]% esAnomalyVlanIfIndex=%parm[#2]% esAnomalyVlanDescr=%parm[#3]% esAnomalySrcMacAddress=%parm[#4]% esAnomalyDestMacAddress=%parm[#5]% esAnomalyVlanTag=%parm[#6]% esAnomalySrcIpAddrType=%parm[#7]% esAnomalySrcIpAddr=%parm[#8]% esAnomalyDestIpAddrType=%parm[#9]% esAnomalyDestIpAddr=%parm[#10]% esAnomalySrcL4Port=%parm[#11]% esAnomalyDestL4Port=%parm[#12]% esAnomalyTcpFlagReason=%parm[#13]% esAnomalyTcpFlag=%parm[#14]% esAnomalyTcpSeq=%parm[#15]%

event.descr:
For ports on which the protocol anomaly protection TCP fragment features has been enabled, this trap will be generated when a packet received on that port if 1) the packet is a TCP, and its size of the TCP header is less than pre-configured value; or 2) the packet is a TCP and it is a IP fragmented packet (IP offset != 0)

esAnomalyPortIfIndex %parm[#1]%;

esAnomalyVlanIfIndex %parm[#2]%;

esAnomalyVlanDescr %parm[#3]%;

esAnomalySrcMacAddress %parm[#4]%;

esAnomalyDestMacAddress %parm[#5]%;

esAnomalyVlanTag %parm[#6]%;

esAnomalySrcIpAddrType %parm[#7]%;

unknown(0) ipv4(1) ipv6(2) ipv4z(3) ipv6z(4) dns(16)

esAnomalySrcIpAddr %parm[#8]%;

esAnomalyDestIpAddrType %parm[#9]%;

unknown(0) ipv4(1) ipv6(2) ipv4z(3) ipv6z(4) dns(16)

esAnomalyDestIpAddr %parm[#10]%;

esAnomalyTcpFragmentReason %parm[#11]%;

unknown(0) tcpHdrLessSize(1) tcpFragmented(2)

esAnomalyTcpHdrSize %parm[#12]%;
event.logmsg: extremeIpSecurityAnomalyTcpFragmentViolation trap received esAnomalyPortIfIndex=%parm[#1]% esAnomalyVlanIfIndex=%parm[#2]% esAnomalyVlanDescr=%parm[#3]% esAnomalySrcMacAddress=%parm[#4]% esAnomalyDestMacAddress=%parm[#5]% esAnomalyVlanTag=%parm[#6]% esAnomalySrcIpAddrType=%parm[#7]% esAnomalySrcIpAddr=%parm[#8]% esAnomalyDestIpAddrType=%parm[#9]% esAnomalyDestIpAddr=%parm[#10]% esAnomalyTcpFragmentReason=%parm[#11]% esAnomalyTcpHdrSize=%parm[#12]%

event.descr:
For ports on which the protocol anomaly protection ICMP features has been enabled, this trap will be generated when an ICMP packet received on that port if 1) the size of ICMP (IP payload) is large thant pre-configured value; or 2) it is a fragmented IP/ICMP packet (IP offset != 0)

esAnomalyPortIfIndex %parm[#1]%;

esAnomalyVlanIfIndex %parm[#2]%;

esAnomalyVlanDescr %parm[#3]%;

esAnomalySrcMacAddress %parm[#4]%;

esAnomalyDestMacAddress %parm[#5]%;

esAnomalyVlanTag %parm[#6]%;

esAnomalySrcIpAddrType %parm[#7]%;

unknown(0) ipv4(1) ipv6(2) ipv4z(3) ipv6z(4) dns(16)

esAnomalySrcIpAddr %parm[#8]%;

esAnomalyDestIpAddrType %parm[#9]%;

unknown(0) ipv4(1) ipv6(2) ipv4z(3) ipv6z(4) dns(16)

esAnomalyDestIpAddr %parm[#10]%;

esAnomalyIcmpReason %parm[#11]%;

unknown(0) icmpOverSize(1) icmpFragmented(2)
event.logmsg: extremeIpSecurityAnomalyIcmpViolation trap received esAnomalyPortIfIndex=%parm[#1]% esAnomalyVlanIfIndex=%parm[#2]% esAnomalyVlanDescr=%parm[#3]% esAnomalySrcMacAddress=%parm[#4]% esAnomalyDestMacAddress=%parm[#5]% esAnomalyVlanTag=%parm[#6]% esAnomalySrcIpAddrType=%parm[#7]% esAnomalySrcIpAddr=%parm[#8]% esAnomalyDestIpAddrType=%parm[#9]% esAnomalyDestIpAddr=%parm[#10]% esAnomalyIcmpReason=%parm[#11]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent whenever a MAU is inserted or removed. When the mau is inserted, the value of extremePortMauStatus will be 'insrted' and extremePortMauType indicates the type of the mau inserted. If mau is removed, the value of extremePortMauStatus is empty and the type of the mau will be NONE

ifIndex %parm[#1]%;

extremePortMauType %parm[#2]%;

extremePortMauStatus %parm[#3]%;

inserted(1) empty(2)
event.logmsg: extremePortMauChangeTrap trap received ifIndex=%parm[#1]% extremePortMauType=%parm[#2]% extremePortMauStatus=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
Notification of process exceeding CPU utilization threshold. Notification is send every extremeCpuMonitorInterval value in seconds until utilization falls below threshold.

extremeCpuMonitorSlotId %parm[#1]%;

extremeCpuMonitorProcessName %parm[#2]%;

extremeCpuMonitorCurrentUtilization %parm[#3]%;

extremeCpuMonitorThreshold %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: extremeSwMonitorCpuUtilization trap received extremeCpuMonitorSlotId=%parm[#1]% extremeCpuMonitorProcessName=%parm[#2]% extremeCpuMonitorCurrentUtilization=%parm[#3]% extremeCpuMonitorThreshold=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
The service expiry notification is generated about 90 days service contract expiration, then 60,30,7 days and daily after that.

extremeServiceLicenseExpiryDate %parm[#1]%;

extremeServiceLicenseType %parm[#2]%;

imageDescription %parm[#3]%;

noOfDaysLeft %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: extremeServiceLicenseExpiration trap received extremeServiceLicenseExpiryDate=%parm[#1]% extremeServiceLicenseType=%parm[#2]% imageDescription=%parm[#3]% noOfDaysLeft=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
Trial license expiry notification is generated every day.

trialPeriod %parm[#1]%;

imageDescription %parm[#2]%;

noOfDaysLeft %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: extremeTrialLicenseExpiration trap received trialPeriod=%parm[#1]% imageDescription=%parm[#2]% noOfDaysLeft=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The extremeStackMemberOverheat notification is generated when the temperature of the stack member reaches the threshold temperature

sysDescr %parm[#2]%;

extremeCurrentTemperature %parm[#3]%;

extremeStackMemberSlotId %parm[#4]%;

event.descr:
The extremeStackMemberStatusChanged notification is generated when the operational status of the stack member changes

extremeStackMemberSlotId %parm[#1]%;

extremeStackMemberOperStatus %parm[#2]%;

up(1) down(2) mismatch(3)

ifIndex %parm[#1]%;

extremeStackingPortRemoteMac %parm[#2]%;

extremeStackingPortLinkSpeed %parm[#3]%;

extremeStackingPortLinkStatus %parm[#4]%;

up(1) down(2)

event.descr:
Change in status of System Power The trap will not be generated for discovering state.

sysDescr %parm[#1]%;

extremeSystemPowerState %parm[#2]%;

computing(1) sufficientButNotRedundantPower(2) redundantPowerAvailable(3) insufficientPower(4)

A overheat trap indicates that the on board tempature sensor has reported a overheat condition. System will shutdown until unit has suficiently cooled such that operation may begin again. A cold start trap will be issued when the unit has come back on line.

event.descr:
A fan failed trap indicates one or more of the cooling fans inside the device has failed. A fanOK trap will be sent once the fan has attained normal operation.

sysUpTime %parm[#1]%;

sysDescr %parm[#2]%;

extremeFanNumber %parm[#3]%;

event.descr:
A fan has transitioned out of a failure state and is now operating correctly.

sysUpTime %parm[#1]%;

sysDescr %parm[#2]%;

extremeFanNumber %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: extremeFanOK trap received sysUpTime=%parm[#1]% sysDescr=%parm[#2]% extremeFanNumber=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
A user attempted to login to console or by telnet but was refused access due to incorrect username or password

sysDescr %parm[#2]%;

event.descr:
Attached Redundant Power Supply device is indicating an alarm condition.

sysUpTime %parm[#1]%;

sysDescr %parm[#2]%;

Attached Redundant Power Supply device is no longer indicating an alarm condition.

sysUpTime %parm[#1]%;

sysDescr %parm[#2]%;

Signifies that the value of one of the object identifiers (or the value of an object below that in the MIB tree) defined in the extremeSmartTrapRulesTable has changed, and hence a new entry has been created in the extremeSmartTrapInstanceTable. Such a trap is sent at most once every thirty seconds if one or more entry was created in the last thirty seconds.

sysUpTime %parm[#1]%;

sysDescr %parm[#2]%;

event.descr: The server load balancer has activated a group of virtual servers that it normally would not activate. This may be due to the failure of another server load balancer.

The server load balancer has deactivated a group of virtual servers that it normally has active. This indicates that something is wrong in the server load balancer; for example, its ping check may be failing.

This node discovers a new neighbor through Extreme Discovery Protocol.

event.descr:
The extremeEapsConfigChange notification is generated when the EAPS configuration has changed. It is sent 30 seconds after the first change is made to limit the number of traps sent

extremeEapsLastConfigurationChange %parm[#1]%;

The extremeEapsLastStatusChangeTime notification is generated 10 seconds after a status change occurs. Within the 10 second period all status changes cause extremeEapsLastStatusChange variable to be updated. 10 seconds after the first change, this trap is sent. This is to ensure a management station is notified that a change occured, in case the regular traps are dropped due to be being sent while the network is converging.

extremeEapsLastStatusChange %parm[#1]%;

extremeWirelessProbeInfoSource %parm[#2]%;

This trap is generated when counter measures are started on a wireless interface.

ifIndex %parm[#1]%;

extremeWirelessCounterMeasureSource %parm[#2]%;

clientReport(1) micFailure(2)

This trap is generated when counter measures are stopped on a wireless interface.

ifIndex %parm[#1]%;

This trap is generated when a wireless interface tries to autoselect a channel. It indicates whether a particular channel scan was successful, or if it failed then the reason for the failure.

ifIndex %parm[#1]%;

extremeWirelessPhysInterfacePHYChannel %parm[#2]%;

extremeWirelessPhysInterfaceChannelAutoSelectStatus %parm[#3]%;

notApplicable(0) inProgress(1) success(2) radarInterferenceDuringScan(3) radarInterferenceDuringOperation(4) restartedDueToInterference(5)
Uncatagorized trap.
Service Came Down.
Service Came Up.
System Reset.
REQUEST DENIAL
Root Login.
Removing unit. Potential failover of this load balancer.
Adding unit. This load balancer has taken responsibility for a new unit id.
